messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
My brother is having a breakdown in open.
Okay, is anybody injured?
My brother, yes.
What kind of breakdown is he having?
Um, uh, he's acting nice.
Okay, how old is he?
Has he done anything harmful?
No, not yet.
Does he have any weapons?
I don't know, seriously.
I'm sending you help, but tell me more. What's your brother's name?
Kyle Miller.
Okay, where is he right now?
He's downstairs right now.
So what made you call? What did he do?
I just woke up to my mom screaming because my brother has a knife, and he's trying to cut himself and stuff.
Okay, hang on the phone with me. Don't go anywhere.
Yeah, probably.
So Kyle still has the knife?
I'm not sure right now. I think so.
What kind of knife is it?
It's just a... just a kitchen knife.
Like a pocket knife?
Yeah, a pocket knife.
Does he have access to any other weapons that you know of?
No, I don't think so.
Who's screaming?
It's my mom.
Has anybody been injured yet? Has Kyle hurt anybody else?
He hurt himself.
Where did he cut himself?
Do you know what part? He has a gun. It's a BB gun, but it's a...
Okay. So what part of the house is he in?
I think he's out in the garage or out in the front yard now.
Does anybody know where exactly he is?
My mom doesn't know. I'm going to go look for him right now, but...
Okay. I don't want you to put yourself in danger, but we have people coming to help. They're going to need to know where he is, okay?
Okay.
If you can sort of peek out the door or something, is there a safe way for you to look out?
Hey, in the meantime, can I get your name real quick?
Alex Miller.
Okay, so what is Kyle wearing today?
A white shirt.
A white shirt and what else? Shorts or jeans?
Basketball shorts.
Alright. What does he look like? Is he tall, short, thin, heavy?
He's taller, medium build.
Okay, has he done anything else you haven't mentioned?
No, not really.
Do you know where he is now?
He's in the front yard right now, talking to my mom and the neighbor.
Does he still have the BB gun?
Yeah, it's actually an airsoft gun. It's a different gun than I thought, but yeah, he's right out front.
Is he heading towards Aspen Street?
Yes, he's heading down there now.
Does he still have the airsoft gun in his hand?
No, he put it down.
What about the pocket knife? Does he still have that?
I'm not sure if he does or not.
So when you said he hurt himself or cut himself earlier, do you know where he cut himself?
The only thing I saw was his arm with the knife.
Okay. He doesn't have the gun anymore?
No, but he still has the airsoft gun.
Is there any way you can let them know he's holding the airsoft gun?
Yes, I will.
Okay, listen, the officers are trained in this type of situation. They're not going to go around shooting people, okay? They understand and just want to keep everyone safe.
Okay.
Can you still see him?
No, he took off down the road towards Aspen Street.
Okay, so he took off running down the road towards Aspen Street and you can't see him anymore?
Yes.
Okay, I've got some officers who are nearby. They will make sure Kyle is under control and safe. Probable follow-up officers will come to talk to you shortly.
Okay.
Just wait at your house, officers will be there shortly.
Okay.
Alright, bye-bye.
Bye.
911, what's your emergency?
Yes, this is Kristen Pritz. I'm on Aspen Street. There's an officer that has stopped his car and has a citizen. He's holding him with a gun. I mean, he's got his gun pointed out.
We know.
I just wanted to make sure that you know he needed backup.
Yes, we know. Thank you.
Bye.
